description:
MIGRATING status doesn't reset when an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR occurred.

It seems that deserialize_remote_exception method(nova/openstack/common/rpc/common.py) create an InvalidSharedStorage_Remote ERROR dynamically from an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR,so nova-scheduler can not catch an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR.

nova-scheduler should catch an InvalidSharedStorage_Remote Error to reset MIGRATING status.
title: MIGRATING status doesn't reset when an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR occurred.

comments.content:
MIGRATING status doesn't reset when an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR occurred.

It seems that deserialize_remote_exception method(nova/openstack/common/rpc/common.py) create an InvalidSharedStorage_Remote ERROR dynamically from an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR, 
so nova-scheduler can not catch an InvalidSharedStorage ERROR.

nova-scheduler should catch an InvalidSharedStorage_Remote Error to reset MIGRATING status.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~h-eguchi

comments.content: InvalidSharedStorage_Remote is a subclass of InvalidSharedStorage so the catch should owrk. There must be something else going on.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content: What code version are you running?  There's a fix that should address this in trunk and grizzly-rc1.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content: Hi. Have you had a chance to test this with trunk?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content: Any news about how to fix it? Thank you.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~luisguilherme-cr

comments.content: 2 year old bug, that was reported fixed in grizzly
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
